intro: Scilla triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered squill, is a perennial bulbous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 15–30 centimeters and features narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers in early spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Scilla triflora is often used in rock gardens and as a decorative plant in gardens due to its delicate appearance.
